title: Tracking Issue for `stdio_makes_pipe`

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Feature gate: `#![feature(stdio_makes_pipe)]`

This is a tracking issue for the `makes_pipe()` method of `std::process::Stdio`.

Wrappers around `std::process::Command` may want to be able to override pipe creation. However, [std::process::Stdio](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/process/struct.Stdio.html) is opaque so without this method there's no way to tell if `Command` is being told to create new pipes or not.

### Public API

```rust
// in std::process

impl Stdio {
     pub fn makes_pipe(&self) -> bool;
}
```

### Steps / History

- [ ] Implementation: #97150
- [ ] Final comment period (FCP)
- [ ] Stabilization PR

### Unresolved Questions

- Bikeshedding the name. `is_piped()` has been suggested to match [`piped()`](https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/process/struct.Stdio.html#method.piped).
